senses.sense_definition: A smooth, reddish-brown nut found inside a prickly casing, often eaten roasted.

examples.text: We gathered fresh <w>chestnuts</w> from the forest floor in autumn.
The street vendor was selling hot roasted <w>chestnuts</w> to tourists.

senses.sense_definition: A large tree that produces chestnuts.

examples.text: The old <w>chestnut</w> in the park provides excellent shade in the summer.
Leaves from the <w>chestnut</w> turned a beautiful gold in October.
The artist used a rich <w>chestnut</w> for the background of the portrait.
She dyed her hair a warm <w>chestnut</w> to match the season.

senses.sense_definition: An old joke, story, or subject that has been repeated so often that it is no longer interesting or funny.

examples.text: He told that old <w>chestnut</w> about the fisherman again at the party.
The journalist avoided the political <w>chestnut</w> regarding tax reform.

senses.sense_definition: A horse with a reddish-brown coat and no black points.

examples.text: The jockey mounted the spirited <w>chestnut</w> before the race began.
My neighbor owns a beautiful <w>chestnut</w> that he rides on weekends.

senses.sense_definition: The wood obtained from a chestnut tree, used in building and furniture.

examples.text: The dining table was made of solid <w>chestnut</w> and looked very sturdy.
Builders often use <w>chestnut</w> for fencing because it resists rot.

senses.sense_definition: A hard, rough patch of skin found on the inner leg of a horse.

examples.text: The groom checked the <w>chestnut</w> on the horse's leg during grooming.
Each horse has a unique <w>chestnut</w> that can sometimes be used for identification.
She bought a pair of <w>chestnut</w> boots to match her coat.
The horse had a shiny <w>chestnut</w> coat that gleamed in the sun.
Mr. <w>Chestnut</w> was known for his competitive eating records.
We invited the <w>Chestnut</w> family to dinner last Sunday.
